item.title: I BOUGHT I HOUSE — 24 replies — 66.6/hr
item.content:encoded:
I BOUGHT I HOUSE

Open thread • Replies: 24 • Updated: 2026-02-27 05:46 UTC

OP

I BOUGHT A HOUSE TODAY.
>28
>$290.000
>5.5%
>46,000 down
>1,900 sq ft

First time homeowner. Never did crypto, not my game. All advice I can give you is buy precious metals and commodities. Also CD's are based. I've escaped rentoid hell. I'm out, and I'll never return. Good luck fags, I wish you the best. Low ball these boomer fucks.

Early replies (first 3)

61908662
>he bought?

61908663
>I've escaped rentoid hell.

congrats, you are:
>locked down in 1 place
>have to fix everything
>monthly mortgage payments are the same as renting anyway
>have to pay to fix your own things
>ordinances
>property tax anyway after done with mortgage payments

enjoy, you're now a rentoid to a bank, anon

61908670
slave to the bank for 20+ years living in a second hand home. buying a used house is disgusting

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61908678
>>61908653
I think I'm at 3.25% currently

61908688
>>61908671
I don't have to fix shit.
I can move whenever I want, and whatever rent increase they give me is worth my peace of mind.

I invest everything else I get (everything)
and I'm not locked down to one place forever
feels good man

61908689
>>61908663
>locked down in 1 place
It's a family home in our ideal city, we are never leaving, I don't care
>monthly mortgage payments are the same as renting anyway
When I paid rent that money went into a black hole, now I have house equity. One day I will stop paying mortgage, and only pay property tax. Rent hell this would never happen
>have to pay to fix your own things
Yeah, I did that while renting. I had shit landlords that refused to fix things correctly. But now I have knowledge of fixing shit
>ordinances
Yeah, but at least now I can put a fucking nail in the wall and paint it whatever color I want
>property tax anyway after done with mortgage payments
Don't care, no multi-thousand dollar payment every month.

61908697
>>61908653
>>5.5%
I'm a zoomer, is this really the standard? Sounds like a scam fr no cap

61908699
>>61908689

I will NEVER be a slave to a bank.

25
now 26 you will have stable outflow for as long as you choose to live there. if you want to move you just rent it out for double or triple your mortage. i really dont even understand how people fail to grasp the concept that its economically impossible for cost + profit to be less than cost. inb4 live in your moms basement for free

61908713
>>61908697

item.title: FED ENDS THE SILVER — 12 replies — 18.6/hr
item.content:encoded:
FED ENDS THE SILVER

Open thread • Replies: 12 • Updated: 2026-02-27 05:29 UTC

OP

Rock collecting is not investing, and all dwarves flooding the precious metal threads will end up rugged just like the last time. Yes, I'm jinxing it.

Can I order buy anything with silver — like I can do with Bitcoin near instantly, just sending the money to someone in Japan in a flash? No? Then your silver is not real money, you might as well collect Pokémon cards because it is unironically easier to turn them into cash.

The precious metal fad killed bitcoin, there is no explanation for the wave of liquidations besides whales "diversifying" their asset.

Early replies (first 3)

61908566
You can buy stuff with silver, some fiat currency is made from silver and there is plenty of modern day precedent of trading services and goods for bullion silver

61908571
>>61908537
>like I can do with Bitcoin
nobody does this

61908581
>>61908571
Correct. XRP is much faster, securer and way less fees. Or use RLUSD.

>>61908537
Silver is an industrial metal. They need it for solar panels, data centers, robots, missiles, and many other things.

>>61908537

>>61908818

>>61908581

item.title: $SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in — 76 replies — 59.5/hr
item.content:encoded:
$SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in

Open thread • Replies: 76 • Updated: 2026-02-27 04:51 UTC

OP

This is a risky startup company, but FINALLY this year they are shipping their product. This summer, in fact. They just finished a final round of dilution a month ago, and the stock just hit a critical point where it’s actively in recovery.

It’s a real car, a product that *will* ship that nerds are geeking out about, and it appears now someone big is starting to slowly acquire it.

The first model will have its flaws, but it’s an electric car that can run off the solar panels on its roof. No one has ever done that before.

And the entire fucking company’s marketcap, this Nasdaq company, is $70 million.

You’re welcome.

(Disclosure: I obviously own some moderate sized bags of this, as should you)

Early replies (first 3)

61902124
Go look the shit up on YouTube and do some research. Tech bros will buy out the first line of these as fun geek toys, and by the second and third iterations, it’s gonna start getting serious. The big boys (aka Tesla) cannot afford to let this company get too large under their toes. They’ll acquire the stock and buy them out before that happen. That’s my thesis, anyway. The company’s not perfect, it has issues. But it’s worth more than $70 million for damn sure.

61902143
>>61902111
I believe that oil,nat gas, nuclear energy, clean coal is going to make a comeback, and that the "green" stuff wont be " cool" anymore, I avoid betting on anyting "green". At least I do not think the US will care about solar and wind turbines and all that crap anymore. In the Eu, that car would look ridicolous and nobody would drive it., btw in Eu we drive diesel.

61902157
>>61902124
Almost had me interested before I saw that monstrosity

61908115

61908120
>>61907929
You responding to every criticism post is how I know you're just a desperate baggie

61908205
>>61908115
Yeah they went public late last year and absolutely have ate shit since then, and did a round of dilution in January even to get this thing out the door. No one’s arguing that. I just think the stock has reached a buy point. If you check the price action the past month, the market agrees with me.

>>61907984
Bruh if one of the big boys wants to buy out this stock, that doesn’t bother me as a recent investor.

>>61908120
A baggie maybe, but not desperate. I just got into this a few days ago, so I’m actually up slightly. I’m just enjoying having a /biz/ where we can share ideas that aren’t the shitcoin du jour.

61908329
>>61908205
>if one of the big boys wants to buy out this stock, that doesn’t bother me as a recent investor
No you moron, I'm trying to say that in all likelihood that WON'T happen. Because there's lots of startups and most don't have the capital or connections to make it through and break into success.
If you want people to invest in this particular stock then convince us that they're special.

61908330
1. the stock is down heavy.
2. OP is replying A LOT which is mega sus
3. it is rebounding a bit
4. OP is probably a fag baiting plebs into buying his bags (ie. selling calls, while dumping shares or selling puts and buying shares aka the gay price action)
5. i dont know what to do. that car is ugly as fuck. but even if they somehow match their next competitor MC that makes this an easy 100x

>>61907174
This was in peak "you vill eat ze bugs" era all the faggot companies like EV stocks, BYND, etc mooned in 2020. The EV market is far more refined now. No one is going to throw money at this just because it's an EV company like they were back then. Anything BYD puts out absolutely creams this garbage at like 1/5 the price.

>>61902193
>>61902208

>>61903586

61908857

So what? I put a couple hundred bucks in and it crashes? Oh well, but if it gains traction than I turned my idle money into profit. I don't see anyone else here sharing any stocks or crypto. Just shit talking and gaslighting, So I'm betting on the optimistic anon.

61908863
>>61908849
that's a good one nigger, you got me

61909007
>>61908519
Oh shit that’s awesome, an actual enthusiast. You must be a decently well off tech bro to pre-order something like that; I think that’ll be the first wave. The practical crowd will come later, but just imagine how cool an SUV model you can camp in will be - even if they have to cut some efficiency and it’ll need to be third gen or further.

And besides what these idiots are saying, a vehicle that can power itself by the literal sun is neat. I’m looking forward to the first retard who drives across the coast on solar power alone - though it’ll take a while. Anyway, thanks for chipping in.

>>61908857
That’s a good way to look at it because despite how neat the tech is, this company has real issues. But what startup company doesn’t. Still, I’m in for my money.

61909028
>>61908843
>EV market is shrinking
Only in the US, and only in the US because the federal rebate went away, and companies such as Ford thought people actually wanted $140k electric pickup trucks.

61909297
i'm up almost 30% on my calls
cheers OP

People can tell when you're struggling to act, pretend, trying to follow a script, etc. People are pretty good at detecting insincerity. The sheer number of dipshits that believe whatever their favorite Youtuber says might suggest otherwise, but that's really just a testament to how prolific skilled actors have become.
You can detect "soul" from "soulless" in content the same way. You spot AI images the same way, and you used to spot Photoshopped images the same way.
>I thought i was acting normalfag and friendly
Yeah, people can tell you're putting an inordinate amount of effort into acting "normal". They notice that you're not comfortable, and that makes them suspicious. It's a catch-22. You want to follow the social script, but you adhere to your image of it too strictly. Because you don't actually, in action, understand it. This is because you were not "properly socialized" as a child <- that's what people mean when they talk about socializing children.

61908866
>>61907350

Apparently this makes me seem strangely, even suspiciously nice. Tend to tell people I've seen how jokes/teases can come to mind again and contribute to a person's doom spiral. 61909198
>>61908514

61909269
>>61908726
"I have an extraordinarily stimulating home, family, and social life outside of work, and I try to support and bring a focused atmosphere in the office."

The clique at the office is toxic. It doesn't matter how nice and inclusive they are on the outside, the point of being in their little in-group is so they feel accepted and trusted by you, so they can strategize around what vulnerabilities they learn about you through "socialization"
It's also important to realize the clique at the office will not be composed of the most senior and productive workers. It will be largely "new" people to the corporation, who are trying to compound and roll the freshman happy-go-lucky "I made it" vibes perpetually.
Unfortunately, being a simpleton and going with the crowd at work is a way to reduce your own role, executive actions, and relevance in your life. If 20 people have to walk together and get coffee every day because.. it's what they do...they're essentially automatons, preprogrammed. If you're forced to walk at an uncomfortably brisk pace to keep up with the lead Alpha Team Member on your walks, you're being actively cucked

OP, you should be satisfied in knowing you don't fit in. You probably don't want to fit in.

61909282
>>61907350

61909303
>>61907350

item.title: Why do people even bother daytrading BTC? — 6 replies — 4.8/hr
item.content:encoded:
Why do people even bother daytrading BTC?

Open thread • Replies: 6 • Updated: 2026-02-27 04:52 UTC

OP

Why do people even bother daytrading BTC? Its a mirror image of NASDAQ why would you not just trade NASDAQ

Early replies (first 3)

61906649
>>61906467
bitcoin!

61906658
have to kyc to trade stock shit plus a ton of other shit that's annoying like day trading laws. not to mention the reduction in volatility.

61908907
>>61906467
Bitcoin is open 24/7 and you don't have 100x leverage on regular brokers

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61908923
le stock market? simply boring. don't even waste my time with outdated trash. Oh I'm sorry did your 401k drawdown 80% overnight on sunday because SCUMP tweeted something misogynist? Not my problem. Never my problem

61908927
I only trade it because it goes 24/7 and I like seeing the line move

61909302
>>61906467
>5Y VOO returns, no reinvested dividends- +77.69%
>5Y BTC returns, no staking or yield shenanigans - +18.1%
People choose BTC because they hate returns.
